ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a lot of hands-on experience in research. I was excited by my progress towards my master's thesis, and I appreciated the chance to work in lab for more time during the academic semester.
Tons of lab experience, insight into reading papers, designing experiments, and assessing feasibility of research endeavors.
How to be a better science researcher and manage my time

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength is the independence and immersion into the academic lab setting. One way it can be improved is more interaction between the students in the BS/MS program, because it would be nice to learn from each other while we complete the same program requirements.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This course is required for the BS/MS program, but I very much recommend this program to other students. It really lets you own your own project with more time devoted during the academic year. Depending on the lab, you can really improve your scientific communication and presentation skills.
Yes, if you want intensive research experience at a grad level this is the course for you.
